DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the association between acid reflux and cell changes in Barrett's esophagus. Specific aim 1: To test the hypothesis that controlled acid reflux is associated with lesser degree of stromal activation. Specific aim 2: To test the hypothesis that stromal fibroblast derived growth factors drive BE epithelial proliferation.
DOC.brief_title: Influence of Acid Reflux on Stromal Epithelial Interaction in Barrett's Esophagus
DOC.criteria: 1. Prior histological demonstration of Barrett's esophagus that is endoscopically visible; length of visible segment >/= 1 cm 2. Absence of dysplasia or LGD on biopsies within the past 5 years 3. Ability to provide informed consent 4. Age between 18 years and 90 years at study entry. Exclusion criteria: 1. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 3 or 4 2. Inability to tolerate endoscopic procedures 3. Pregnancy: Females of childbearing age will be screened with pregnancy test. 4. Prior esophageal surgery, or cancer
